text: four brilliant ways to reuse rubbish
what do we do in a world overflowing
with waste our planet is filled to the
brim with rubbish in 2010 we produced
3.5 million tonnes of rubbish per day by
2100 that amount of tripled recycling
isn't enough up to 43 percent of our
plastic waste still ends up in landfills
and up to 20 million tonnes fill our
oceans but there's good news here are 4
grand ideas to deal with the problem for
example in the Indian state of Tamil
Nadu the local government has turned
1600 tons of plastic rubbish 5 years
worth into pavement for a thousand
kilometres of public roads meanwhile in
Rome the city ships rubbish from its
overflowing wings to Austria by train
worth at 70,000 tons of trash is burnt
and converted to electricity to power a
hundred and seventy thousand Austrian
homes elsewhere one group of scientists
says we can polarize a waste into
microscopic nanoparticle that's a boon
to countries like Ghana which have
become dumping grounds for some of our
sixty five million tons of old thrown
out electronics and finally Indonesia
were half the population lacks medical
care there's garbage clinical insurance
that's where citizens living below the
poverty line collect rubbish from the
street delivering the recyclable bits in
exchange for money toward healthcare
turning trash into something for the
greater good now that's a grand idea
